snippet: Joseph J. Esposito, formerly the New York Police Department’s highest-ranking chief, was warned by Judge Shira A. Scheindlin that his testimony about stop-and-frisk practices was becoming “a narrative.”
abstract: Joseph J Esposito, formerly New York Police Department’s highest-ranking chief, is warned by Judge Shira A Scheindlin that his testimony about stop-and-frisk practices was 'turning into a narrative;' he is also rebuffed at several points when his discourses on crime-fighting expands beyond lawyers’ narrow questions.
lead_paragraph: Joseph J. Esposito, formerly the New York Police Department’s highest-ranking chief, was warned by Judge Shira A. Scheindlin that his testimony about stop-and-frisk practices was becoming “a narrative.”

headline.seo: At Stop-and-Frisk Trial, Judge Tells Ex-Chief of Police Not to Turn Testimony Into a Speech
headline.main: Judge Tells Ex-Chief of Police Not to Turn Testimony Into a Speech
headline.print_headline: Judge Tells Ex-Chief of Police Not to Turn Testimony Into a Speech
